bibl.title: Pap. Ant. III. 115 and the Iambic Prologue in Late Greek Poetry.
bibl.note: The 40 iambic lines in P. Ant. III, 115 are part of the prologue to an encomium in hexameters, and not an independent poem. The addressee may possibly be identified with Archelaos, Praetorian Prefect of the East 524-529.
Cameron Alan, Pap. Ant. III. 115 and the Iambic Prologue in Late Greek Poetry.
